t/introduction.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi jobs'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Wizzi jobs are the task manager of the Wizzi factory.
            \b They execute a sequence of \b
            html/docs/to-docs( Wizzi model )
            span \b loadings and \b
            html/docs/to-docs( artifact generations )
            span .

        p They are configured using `wfjob` ITTF documents, and are execute using
            \b the `executeWizziJob` method of a 
            html/docs/to-docs( wizzi.WizziFactory )
            span \b instance or the `wizzi`
                \b command of the `
            html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-cli )
            span ` CLI package.

t/productionmanager.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'The production manager'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

        p The production of complex software systems can
            \b require a great number of model processing, transformations
            \b and artifact generations.

        p The wizzi.production.productionManager class implements an
            \b api for scheduling complex jobs. It is the wizzi factory
            \b task manager.

        p A Wizzi Model type implemented by the 'wizzi-core' plugin , the 'wfjob' schema,
            \b can be used to describe wizzi factory jobs. A 'wfjob' model organizes models processing
            \b and artifact generations in production lines that are executed in 
            \b sequence, so that a line can prepare models and artifacts for the next one.

        p A job is executed calling the following method of the 
            \b wizzi.WizziFactory instance class.

        ittf-panel
            schema js
            ittf
                ...
                    m executeJob
                        { jobRequest
                            string name
                                # for info and error messages
                            string path
                                # path to the 'wfjob' ittf document that the wizzi.production.productionManager will load.
                            { productionOptions
                                boolean verbose
                                    # not implemented yet
                            { globalContext
                                optional
                        callback

t/runnerServer.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'The "runnerServer"'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p When the Wizzi factory is used in a server application,
			\b or in a long running process where many jobs are 
			\b executed, it is useful to access factory
			\b services, prepared at startup, directly from the
			\b JsWizzi code inside ITTF documents.

		p There are two jswizzi global functions for this
			\b purpose.
		
        ul
			
			li $.api( functionName, ... arguments ... )
				p Allow to call a user function declared on start up.
			
			li $.loadModel( modelName )
				p Allow the retrieval of a Wizzi Model preloaded on start up.

		h3 The wizzifile.js
		p ... TODO ...
		
		h4 Event handler wizzifile.onConfig( config )
		p This event is raised before creating the runnerServer instance.
			\b At this point we can call the config.get(propertyName) and
			\b config.set(propertyName, value) methods on the config object.

		h4 Event handler wizzifile.onStart( runnerServerInstance, config )
		p This event is raised before the initialization of the wizzi factory
			\b contained in the runner server. At this point we can call the
			\b runnerServerInstance.registerApi(name, function) method, the
			\b runnerServerInstance.registerPlugin(pluginNameOrPath) method
			\b and the runnerServerInstance.registerGlobalContext(object) method.
		
		h4 Event handler wizzifile.onPrepare( runnerServerInstance, config )
		p This event is raised when the wizzi factory contained in the runner server
			\b has benn initialized. Now it is forbidden to call the
			\b registerPlugin and registerGlobalContext methods but we 
			\b can call the runnerServerInstance.loadModel and
			\b runnerServerInstance.transformModel methods.

t/wfjob.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'The "wfjob" schema'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p The `wfjob` Wizzi schema, implemented by the `wizzi-core` plugin,
			\b is the configuration schema of a Wizzi job.

		ittf-panel
            title Sample `wfjob` ITTF document.
            ittf
                wfjob wizzi-docs-concepts
                    $
                        var models_folder     = path.join(__dirname, 'models');
                        var html_folder       = path.join(__dirname, 'html');
                        var dest_folder       = "c:/my/wizzi/v5/github/wizzifactory.github.io";
                    
                    models-base-folder ${'$'}{models_folder}
                    
                    model concepts
                        src wizzi-jobs.docs.ittf
                        schema docs

                    line html
                        cwd-folder ${'$'}{html_folder}
                        $raw wfjob/art-wo-html( docs.html.ittf )
                            model-ref concepts
                                transformer docs/preprint
                    
                    production
                        dest-folder ${'$'}{dest_folder}
                        line-ref html            

		ul The `wfjob` Wizzi schema elements are
			li Wfjob
			li Model
			li ModelRef
			li Line
			li LineRef
			li Artifact
			li Production

		h3 The WfJob element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                wfjob {wzName}
                    string title `short-description`
                        # For info and error messages
                    string models-base-folder `path`
                        # The base path to use when the 'src' attribute of models is a relative path
                    string dest-base-folder `path`
                        # The base path of the destination folder of artifacts generated by this job
                        # Can be overridden by the 'dest-folder' attribute of Line elements
                    [ models
                    [ lines
                    [ productions

		h3 Model element
		
		p A model can be:
		ul
			li An ITTF document of a Wizzi schema exposed by a plugin
				\b loaded in the wizzi.WizziFactory instance that is executing the job.
			li A POJO module coded in one of these known formats: 'json', 'nodejs' 
				\b module exporting the function 'toModel'.
		
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    model `model-name`
                        string src `path`
                            # The source path of the ittf document or POJO module.
                            # When relative the base path is the 'models-base-folder' attribute of the
                            # WfJob element.
                        string schema `schema-name`
                            # The name of the Wizzi Model type (wfschema) that will load the
                            # mTree defined in the source ittf document.
                            # Is alternative to the 'format' attribute.
                        string format `format-name`
                            One-of 'json', 'nodejs'
                            # Is alternative to 'schema' attribute.
                        string dump-file `path`
                        [ modelRefs
                            # References to the models to be used, as properties of the mTreeBuildUpContext
                            # parameter, passed to the wizzi-mtree.loader.loadMTree function,
                            # for loading the model mTree.

		h3 ModelRef element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    model-ref `model-name`
                        string export-name `name`
                        [ transformers
		
		h3 Line element
		p Production lines declare artifacts that are processed asynchronously and
			\b concurrently. 
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    line `line-name`
                        string cwd-folder `path`
                        string dest-folder `path`
                        [ artifacts

		h3 Artifact element
		p An Artifact element declares one artifact production that is driven by a
			\b source model. Each production has one driver model, but an Artifact element
			\b can result in many production because the 'src' attribute of this element
			\b may refer to:
			ul
				li one single source model
				li a group of source models described by a glob pattern
				li one single source model which Model element declares a model collection
					\b property, meaning that each item of the collection is a source model
					\b of the production and produces one artifact.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    artifact `artifact-name`
                        # For info and errors messages.
                        string src `path` | `glob-pattern`
                            # Can be:
                            # . the path of a final artifact that must be simply copied in the destination path.   
                            # . the glob-pattern of final artifacts that must be simply copied in the destination path.   
                            # . the path of a source ittf document
                            # . the glob-pattern of sources ittf documents

                        schema `schema-name`
                            # When the 'src' attribute is the path of an ittf document, is the wizzi
                            # model type (wfschema) that will load and validate the document.
                            # Is alternative to the 'format' attribute.
                            # Can be null if the artifact is a final artifact.
                        
                        ignore `path` | `glob-pattern`
                            # Files returned by the 'src' attribute glob-pattern that are to be ignored.
                            # Can be a glob pattern.

                        generation `artifact-generator-name`
                            # The name of the artifact generator that will produce the artifact.
                            # When the artifact is a final artifact must be omitted.
                        
                        dest-path `artifact-file-path`
                            # The 'src' attribute is the default 
                            # relative destination path of the generated artifact, 
                            # but, when set, this attribute overrides the default. 
                            # It may be an absolute path.
                        
                        extension `artifact-file-extension`
                            # The path extension of the generated artifact. 
                            # Optional. The default is the 'src' atribute path extension without 
                            # the ending '.ittf' string.
                        
                        # Child elements
                        [ modelRefs

		h3 Production element
		p Production elements contain a list of references to previously declared
			\b production lines that must be sequentially executed.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    production 'production-name'
                        string dest-folder `path`
                        [ lineRefs

		h3 LineRef element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    line-ref `line-name`

t/factorymodule.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi model factory module'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p The javascript module `schema-name`-factory.g.js exports the method
			\b 'createLoadModel', that is an HOF that returns the 'loadModel' function.
			\b It must be called passing the 'wizzi' object.

		h4 The `schema-name`-factory.g.js API
		p We have seen already this api in the 'plugin' documentation. 
        ittf-panel
            schema js
            ittf
                {
                    func createLoadModel
                        # HOF : returns the loadModel function for the given factory
                        { wizziObject
                            func loadMTree
                                api-ref wizzi-mtree.loader.loadMTree
                                # This function is prepared by the wizzi.WizziFactory instance class
                                # and has repository access functions and load options in its closure.
                            { file
                                api-ref wizzi.util.file
                            { errors
                                api-ref wizzi.errors
                        ...
                        return
                            func loadModel
                                # This returned function require a complex 'loadContext' 
                                # parameter with a lot of interfaces passed.
                                # It will be called by the wizzi.WizziFactory instance and
                                # not directly from client code.
                                string ittfDocumentUri
                                    # The path to the primary ittf document from which
                                    # the mTree will be loaded
                                { loadContext
                                    { __productionManager
                                        api-ref wizzi.production.productionManager
                                        { productionContext
                                            api-ref wizzi.production.productionContext
                                            { aclstat
                                                api-ref wizzi.production.aclstat
                                    { __ittfDocumentStore
                                        api-ref wizzi-repo.ittfDocumentStore
                                    { mTreeBuildUpContext
                                        optional
                                        | api-ref wizzi-plugin.wizziModel
                                        | POJO
                                callback

t/generation.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi models generation'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Wizzi models are generated calling the 'generateModelTypes' method of an 
			\b instance of the wizzi.WizziFactory class, instantiated with the `
            html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-core )
            span `, \b
            html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-js )
            span `, \b
            html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-web )
            span ` plugins.

		ittf-panel
            schema api
            title The wizzi.WizziFactory.generateModelTypes method.
            ittf
                ...
                    m generateModelTypes
                        string wfschemaIttfDocumentUri
                            # The full path to the primary ITTF document of the `wfschema` declaration.
                        string outputPackagePath
                            # The full path of the package folder where the generated artifacts will be written 
                        string wfschemaName
                            # The schema name, for composing the names of the generated artifacts
                        { mTreeBuildUpContext
                            # An object that will be the evaluation context object
                            # during the mTree processing of the `wfschema` ITTF document
                        callback
                            # Returns error or null

t/modelmodule.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'The Wizzi Model module'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p A Wizzi model module contains a javascript class for each
			\b element defined in its 'wfschema' and some standard base
			\b classes.

		h4 Wizzi model classes
		table
			tr
				td wzSourceLineInfo
				td source map item with source file path, row, col of a node
			tr
				td {schema-name}Exception
				td exception object for this Wizzi Model
			tr
				td {schema-name}Context
				td context object for the methods wzInitialize and wzVerify
			tr
				td {schema-name}Base
				td base class for all element classes
			tr
				td {element-name}
				td one class for each element of the `wfschema`

		p  
        
        ittf-panel
            title The wzSourceLineInfo API
		    ittf 
                class wzSourceLineInfo
                    ctor 
                        integer row
                            # 1-based row position of the source ittf node
                        integer col
                            # 1-based column position position of the source ittf node
                        string sourceKey
                            # Key to the source ittf document infos stored in the 'loadHistory' object
                            # The 'loadHistory' is a property of the root element
                    m toString
                        { elementInstance?

		ittf-panel
            title The `schema-name`Exception API
            ittf 
                class `schema-name`Exception
                    ctor
                        string message
                        { ittfNode
                        { elementInstance

		ittf-panel
            title The `schema-name`Context API
		    ittf 
			    class `schema-name`Context
				    boolean schemaIsValid
				    m addError
					    string message
                        { mTreeNode
                    m verifyEnum
                        string valueType
                        string valueName
                        string value
                        [ allowed
                            string allowedValue
                        { mTreeNode

		ittf-panel
            title The `schema-name`Base API
		    ittf 
			    class `schema-name`Base
				
                    string wzName
                    string wzTag
                    [ wzChildren
                    
                    ctor
                        string name
                            # the node-value of the source mTreeNode
                            # that becomes the 'wzName' of the newly created element 
                        { sourceLineInfo
                            api-ref wizzimodel.wzSourceLineInfo
                        
                    m wzRoot
                        # Return the model root element instance
                    
                    m wzSourceFilepath
                        # Returns the filepath of an ittf source document given its 'sourceKey'
                        string sourceKey
                    
                    m wzAddChild
                        # Add a child node to the wzChildren collection
                        { elementInstance

                    m wzLoadToChildColl
                        # Creates a new element instance given the type of its source mTreeNode
                        # Append it to the collection passed as parameter.
                        # Call the loadFromNode method of the newly created element
                        # with the source mTreeNode as argument.
                        { mTreeNode
                            # the mTreeNode that we are loading
                        { type
                            # the javascript class of the Wizzi Model element 
                            # that is the type for mTreeNode given its node-name
                        { coll
                            # the collection to which the newly created element should be appended

                    m wzLoadToChildren
                        # Creates a new element instance given the type of its source mTreeNode
                        # Append it to the wzChildren collection.
                        # Call the loadFromNode method of the newly created element
                        # with the source mTreeNode as argument.
                        { mTreeNode
                        { type
                    
                    m wzLoadOneToOne
                        # Creates a new element instance given the type of its source mTreeNode
                        # Assign it to the `fieldName` property.
                        # Call the loadFromNode method of the newly created element
                        # with the source mTreeNode as argument.
                        { mTreeNode
                        { type
                        string fieldName
                    
                    m error
                        # throw a `schema-name`Exception
                        string message
                        { mTreeNode

		ittf-panel
            title The `element-name` API
            ittf 
                class `element-name`
                    
                    m loadChild
                        # Tests if the mTreeNode name is a valid child element or attribute.
                        # If yes call the proper add method and return true.
                        # If no return false.
                        { mTreeNode
                    
                    m loadFromNode
                        # Calls the loadChild method on this element
                        # for each child node of the mTreeNode to load.
                        { mTreeNode
                    
                    m wzInitialize
                        # Initialize the element
                        # Called after the source mTree has been succesfully loaded.
                        param ctx
                            api-ref `schema-name`Context
                    
                    m wzVerify
                        # Verify if the element is valid
                        # Called after the wzInitialize method.
                        { ctx
                            api-ref `schema-name`Context

t/introduction.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi models'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Wizzi models are javascript objects, inspired by Xml document objects,
			\b that can load \b
            html/docs/to-docs( mTrees )
            span , applying a type to their nodes.

		p To be loaded in a Wizzi model an mTree node structure must be conformant to the \b
            html/docs/to-docs( Wizzi schema )
			span \b of the model.

		$*
        p A Wizzi schema is declared by an ITTF Document of type `wfschema`,
			\b implemented by the \b
			a `wizzi-core`
				href ${wzCtx.Github.baseUrl}/packages/wizzi-core
			span \b plugin. A wizzi schema is a Wizzi model description.
        *$

		p Wizzi models are software artifacts generated by artifact generators
			\b of the `wizzi-core` plugin. From a 'wfschema' are generated:
			ul
				li a Wizzi Model javascript module
				li a Wizzi model factory javascript module
				li a JSON documentation file.
			
		h4 Wizzi model artifact generators and links to source code
		table 
			class pretty-table
			tr
				th artifact
				th output file name
				th source code
					@ colspan 2
			tr
				td wfschema/factory
				td {schema-name}-factory.g.js
				td
					a \b    ittf    \b
						href ${wzCtx.Github.wizziCorePath}/.wizzi/ittf/lib/artifacts/wfschema/factory/gen/main.js.ittf
				td
					a \b    javascript    \b    
						href ${wzCtx.Github.wizziCorePath}/dist/lib/artifacts/wfschema/factory/gen/main.js
			tr
				td wfschema/model
				td {schema-name}-model.g.js
				td
					a \b    ittf    \b
						href ${wzCtx.Github.wizziCorePath}/.wizzi/ittf/lib/artifacts/wfschema/model/gen/main.js.ittf
				td
					a \b    javascript    \b    
						href ${wzCtx.Github.wizziCorePath}/dist/lib/artifacts/wfschema/model/gen/main.js
			tr
				td wfschema/json_docs
				td {schema-name}-schema.g.json
				td
					a \b    ittf    \b
						href ${wzCtx.Github.wizziCorePath}/.wizzi/ittf/lib/artifacts/wfschema/json_docs/gen/main.js.ittf
				td
					a \b    javascript    \b    
						href ${wzCtx.Github.wizziCorePath}/dist/lib/artifacts/wfschema/json_docs/gen/main.js

index.html.ittf.contents:
html
    $global
        var dollar = '$';
    $
        var art = {
            title: 'Plugins'
        };
    
    html/_layouts/docs-layout(&art)
    
        $include ./introduction
        $include ./architect
        $include ./api
        $include ./core
        $include ./default
        $include ./npm
        $include ./local

t/api.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'The wizzi-plugin.FactoryPlugin API'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p This api must be implemented by any Wizzi plugin.
		
		p The methods of the api will be called by the
            html/docs/high-code( wizzi.PluginsManager )
            span instance class
			    \b  on requests received by the \b
            html/docs/to-docs( wizzi.WizziFactory )
            span \b instance.
		
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    #
                        # Retrieve a Wizzi Model factory by its schema name
                        # Searching in this wizzi package. No search up in "node_modules" folders.
                    m getModelFactory
                        string schemaName
                        ...
                    -
                    #
                        # Retrieve a model transformer by its name
                        # Searching in this wizzi package. No search up in "node_modules" folders.
                    m getModelTransformer
                        string transformerName
                        ...
                    -
                    # 
                        # Retrieve an artifact generator by its name
                        # Searching in this wizzi package. No search up in "node_modules" folders.
                    m getArtifactGenerator
                        string generationName
                    -
                    #
                        # Retrieve a wizzi schema definition in JSON format
                        # Searching in this wizzi package. No search up in "node_modules" folders.
                    m getSchemaDefinition
                        string schemaName

		h4 Object returned by the getModelFactory method

		p This api is requested to the wizzi.PluginsManager from the
			\b  wizzi.WizziFactory when a client needs to load a
            html/docs/to-docs( Wizzi model )
            span . The wizzi.WizziFactory, and not the client, will call the
                html/docs/high-code( createLoadModel )
			    span and 
                html/docs/high-code( loadModel )
                span functions.
		
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                {
                    func createLoadModel
                        # HOF : returns the loadModel function for the given factory
                        { wizziObject
                            func loadMTree
                                api-ref wizzi-mtree.loader.loadMTree
                                # This function is prepared by the wizzi.WizziFactory instance class
                                # and has repository access functions and load options in its closure.
                            { file
                                api-ref wizzi.util.file
                                # TODO this object should be a virtual file system service provided by
                                # store implementations.
                            { errors
                                api-ref wizzi.errors
                        ...
                        return
                            func loadModel
                                # This function require a complex 'loadContext' 
                                # parameter.
                                # It will be called by the wizzi.WizziFactory instance and
                                # not directly from client code.
                                string ittfDocumentUri
                                    # The path to the primary ittf document from which
                                    # the mTree will be loaded
                                { loadContext
                                    { __productionManager
                                        api-ref wizzi.production.productionManager
                                        { productionContext
                                            api-ref wizzi.production.productionContext
                                            { aclstat
                                                api-ref wizzi.production.aclstat
                                    { __ittfDocumentStore
                                        api-ref wizzi-repo.ittfDocumentStore
                                    { mTreeBuildUpContext
                                        optional
                                        | api-ref wizzi-plugin.wizziModel
                                        | POJO
                                callback

		h4 Object returned by the getModelTransformer method
        ittf-panel
            ittf
                {
                    func trans
                        { model
                            | api-ref wizzi-plugin.wizziModel
                            | POJO
                        { ctx
                            api-ref wizzi.artifact.genContext
                        callback

		h4 Object returned by the getArtifactGenerator method
        ittf-panel
            ittf
                {
                    func gen
                        { model
                            | api-ref wizzi-plugin.wizziModel
                            | POJO
                        { ctx
                            api-ref wizzi.artifact.genContext
                        callback

		h4 Object returned by the getSchemaDefinition method
		p The object returned is a JSON representation of the
			\b  requested schema. See the
            a `wfjob` JSON schema definition
                href https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/blob/master/packages/wizzi-core/dist/lib/wizzi/models/wfjob-schema.g.json
            span .

		h4 View the code
		p Have a look at how the
            html/docs/high-code( wizzi-plugin.FactoryPlugin )
            span API is implemented in the \b
			a `wizzi-js` plugin
				href ${wzCtx.Github.baseUrl}/packages/wizzi-js/dist/index.js
            span . See the \b
			a ITTF source
				href https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/blob/master/packages/wizzi-js/.wizzi/ittf/root/index.js.ittf
            span \b also.

t/architect.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Plugin management'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Wizzi uses a class that implements the
            html/docs/high-code( wizzi.PluginsManager )
            span Api to resolve and load plugins.
		
		p Wizzi plugins can be nodejs packages installed locally or globally or can be
			\b folders in packages that make a private use of them.
		
		p Plugins used by the
            html/docs/to-docs( wizzi.WizziFactory )
            span class must be requested at initialization time and cannot be changed. 
			    \b To use a different plugin set a new instance of 
                \b the Wizzi factory class must be created.

		ittf-panel
            title ITTF pseudo-code of the wizzi.WizziFactory.initialize method
            ittf
                ...
                    m initialize
                        { options
                            { repo
                                ...
                            { plugins
                                [ items
                                    string pluginNameOrFile
                                string pluginsBaseFolder
                                    default process.cwd()
                            { test
                                ...
		p The 
            html/docs/high-code( items )
            span property of the
            html/docs/high-code( options.plugins )
            span object is an array of:
			ul
				li Package names, when plugins are contained in npm installed nodejs packages
				li Relative paths to plugins index module, when plugins are contained
					\b in private folders.
		span In the case of relative paths the property
            html/docs/high-code( pluginsBaseFolder )
			span of the
            html/docs/high-code( options.plugins )
            span object must contains the base folder of the plugin.

		h4 View the code
		p Have a look at how the
            html/docs/high-code( wizzi.PluginsManager )
            span is implemented in the \b
			a `wizzi` package
				href ${wzCtx.Github.baseUrl}/packages/wizzi/dist/lib/services/pluginsManager.js

t/core.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Core plugins',
            id: 'coreplugins'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p The Wizzi Factory is a content agnostic data processor and is not aimed at any particular domain.
			\b The plugins are domain specific and content aware. The plugins do the real work.

		p Anyhow the Wizzi Factory has one core plugin, the `
            html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-core )
            span ` plugin, that is integrated in its API.

t/default.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Default plugins',
            id: 'defaultplugins'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Default plugins are starter plugins to help the creation of the firsts domain specific generations.
            
            
        h4 Currently available default plugins
        ul 
            li
                html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-js )
            li
                html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-web )
            li
                html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-lab )

        p The `wizzi-js` and `wizzi-web` plugin at the moment are integrated in the Wizzi API.

t/introduction.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi plugins'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Wizzi is a generation framework
			\b implemented by plugins.
				
		p Kernel modules themself have a 
			\b pluggable architecture. The \b
            html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-mtree )
            span \b package is a plugin
                \b that implements an api for building \b
                html/docs/to-docs( tree structures )
                span \b from \b
                    html/docs/to-docs( ITTF documents)
                    span .
                        \b The \b
                        html/docs/to-plugin( wizzi-repo )
                        span \b package is a plugin that implements
                            \b an api for locating and retrieving ITTF documents.
			
		p A Wizzi plugin exposes to the Wizzi factory the methods for retrieving its:
		ul 
			li Wizzi schema definitions
			li Wizzi models and their factories
			li Wizzi model transformers
			li Artifact generators

		p A plugin package must export the
            html/docs/high-code( createFactoryPlugin )
            span method in its
            html/docs/high-code( index.js )
            span file. The
                html/docs/high-code( FactoryPlugin )
                span class instance returned to the caller
			        \b must implement the
                html/docs/high-code( wizzi-plugin.factoryPlugin )
                span \b API (see below).

		ittf-panel
            title ITTF pseudo-code implementation of the createFactoryPlugin method
            ittf
                set module.exports
                    {
                        ...
                        @ createFactoryPlugin
                            function
                                { wizziPackage
                                { options
                                    [ items
                                        string pluginNameOrFile
                                    string pluginsBaseFolder
                                        default process.cwd()
                                callback
                                ...
                                return
                                    _ callback
                                        @ null
                                        { factoryPlugin
                                            api-ref wizzi-plugin.factoryPlugin


		p A Wizzi plugin should have a standard folder structure so that
		    \b modules can be located given the short public name of
			\b the required item.

		ittf-panel
            title Wizzi plugin standard folder structure
            ittf
                ...
                    {package-name}
                        package.json
                        ...
                        lib
                            artifacts
                                {schema-name}
                                    {artifact-name}
                                        gen
                                            main.js
                                    ...
                                    {transformer-name}
                                        trans
                                            main.js
                                    ...
                                ...
                            utils
                                ...
                            wizzi
                                models
                                    {schema-name}-model.g.js
                                    {schema-name}-factory.g.js
                                    {schema-name}-schema.g.json
                                    ...
                        index.js

t/local.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Local plugins',
            id: 'localplugins'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Local plugins can be located anywhere on the user drive and the plugin folder path is declared to the Wizzi factory
			\b instead of the plugin name.

        p The 
            html/docs/high-code( package.json )
            span file is not required. The plugin interface must be exposed in the
            html/docs/high-code( index.js )
            span file located in the plugin folder.

		ittf-panel
            title Sample Wizzi factory instantiation with local plugins
            ittf
                ...
                    _ wizzi.fsnoaclFactory
                        { plugins
                            [ items
                                @ './packages/wizzi-core/dist/index.js'
                                @ './packages/wizzi-js/dist/index.js'
                                @ './packages/wizzi-web/dist/index.js'
                            @ pluginsBaseFolder
                                _ path.resolve
                                    @ __dirname
                                    @ '..'
                                    @ '..'
                                    @ '..'
                        @ globalContext: globalContext || {}
                        =>
                            param err
                            param wizziFactory
                            if err
                                throw ...
                            _ wizziFactory.loadModelAndGenerateArtifact
                                ...

t/npm.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Npm plugins',
            id: 'npmplugins'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)
        p Npm plugins are public Wizzi plugins published in the npm registry.
        p They should be prefixed with
            html/docs/high-code( wizzi-plugin- )
            span .
        p Create your first Wizzi plugin using the
            html/docs/to-starter( wizzi-plugin )
            span starter.

t/package.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi factory plugin package'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p ArtifactProductions are packaged in node.js/npm modules
			\b containing:
		ul
			li WizziSchemas
			li WizziModels
			li WizziModelFactories
			li WizziModelTransformers
			li ArtifactGenerators

		p A Wizzi factory plugin package has this folder structure
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                node_modules
                    <package-name&gt
                        lib
                            artifacts
                                <wfschema-name&gt
                                    <artifact-name&gt
                                        gen
                                            ittf
                                                [0..n]<ittfdocument-name&gt.<language-wizzi-schema&gt.ittf
                                            main.js
                                            [0..n]<helper-module&gt.js
                                    <transformer-name&gt
                                        trans
                                            main.js
                                            [0..n]<helper-module&gt.js
                            wizzi
                                models
                                    <wfschema-name>-model.js
                                    <wfschema-name>-factory.js
                                schemas
                                    <wfschema-name>.wfschema.ittf
                        index.js

		p The index.js module of the package exports the functions:
			li getWizziModelFactory(wizziSchemaName) 
			li getModelTransformer(transformerPath) 
			li getArtifactGenerator(artifactPath)

index.html.ittf.contents:
html
    $global
        var dollar = '$';
    
    $
        var art = {
            title: 'Wizzi schemas'
        };
    
    html/_layouts/docs-layout(&art)

        $include ./introduction
        $include ./wfschema
        $include ./pseudoschemas
        $include ./json
        $include ./xml
        $include ./text
        $include ./ittf

t/introduction.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Wizzi schemas'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p A Wizzi schema applies a type definition to the nodes of an \b
            a mTree
                href ${wzCtx.Params.baseUrl}/docs/mtrees.html
            span \b and describes the classes of a \b
            a Wizzi model
                href ${wzCtx.Params.baseUrl}/docs/wizzimodels.html
            span \b that can load that mTree type.

        p It is the core modeling tool of the Wizzi factory.

        p A Wizzi schema has its own Wizzi model, of type `wfschema`, 
            \b implemented by the `
            a wizzi-core
                href ${wzCtx.Github.baseUrl}/packages/wizzi-core/dist
            span ` plugin.
                \b It is used by the artifacts of the `wizzi-core` plugin to generate the javascript modules
                \b of the Wizzi model it describes.

		p Wizzi schemas are ITTF documents of type `wfschema`.

        ittf-panel
            title Sample 'rdbms' wizzi schema
            ittf
                wfschema rdbms
                    e catalog
                        r table/s
                    e table
                        r column/s
                        r index/es
                    e column
                        a type
                        a caption
                        a defaultValue
                            tag default
                    e index
                        a primary
                            type boolean
                        a unique
                            type boolean
                        r column/s

        ittf-panel
            title Sample 'rdbms' ITTF document conformant to the above wfschema
            ittf
                rdbms School
                    table Student
                        column Id
                            type integer
                        column Name
                            type string
                        index Student-PK
                            primary true
                            column Id
                    table Course
                        column Id
                            type integer
                        column Title
                            type string
                        index Student-PK
                            primary true
                            column Id

t/ittf.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Ittf pseudo schema'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p Using the ittf pseudo schema may increases the plasticity of a generation
			\b process.
		
		p We can load complex untyped ittf documents
			\b into an mTree and obtain as a result an in-memory simple tree structure
			\b of nodes with a name, a value and a childs collection, that can generate
			\b a new ittf document.

		p We can chain complex mTrees buildups until we get the final ittf document
			\b to load into a Wizzi Model for artifact generation.

t/json.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Json pseudo schema'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		ittf-panel
            schema json
            title Sample json ittf document
            ittf
                {
                    name "v3-docs"
                    version "0.0.1"
                    description  "Wizzi factory documentation."
                    scripts
                        {
                            test "mocha tests/**/*.js"
                            start "node index"
                    dependencies
                        {
                            async "^2.4.0"
                            json-stringify-safe "^5.0.1"
                            ...
                    sampleArray
                        [
                            'alfa'
                            'beta'

        ul Coding rules
            li The root node must be an open graph.
            li Ittf node names may contain
                ul
                    li Property names.
                    li Open graph for start of object.
                    li Open bracket for start of array.
                    li Array elements primitive values.
            li Ittf node values must contain property values when the node name is 
                \b a property name, nothing in the other cases.

        p ( It is assumed that one knows
            a json format rules
                href http://www.json.org/
            span )

t/pseudoschemas.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Internal schemas'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p There are some common document types that have great 
			\b flexibility for the definition of context data, and 
			\b would be usefull to apply to those documents
			\b the templating power of mTrees without the hassle
			\b of a wizzi schema.
		ul
			li Text
			li Xml
			li Json
			li Ittf itself.

		p Respecting a few coding rules these type of documents can be built
			\b using the composition and template commands of ittf documents.

		p The production manager of the wizzi factory recognizes
			\b the following internal schemas
			ul
				li text
				li xml
				li json
				li ittf

		p A wizzi job or a an api call to the wizzi factory may use these schema 
			\b names in any place where a wizzi schema can be used.

t/text.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Text pseudo schema'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p A text ittf document is a bit out of standard. It is
			\b a common text document that can break the rule of
			\b only one root node. It can use any node command or expression
			\b of an ittf document. A preprocessor transforms the text in
			\b a standard ittf tree structure. After the buildup of the mTree
			\b the 'text/document' artifact generator recreates the textual format.

		h4 Example of text mixin for a license file
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ${'$'}params copy, license
                MIT License
                
                Copyright (c) ${'$'}{copy}
                
                ${'$'}if license === 'mit'
                    ${'$'}include mit_license_text
                ${'$'}elif ...

		h4 The mixin transformed by the prepocessor in a standard format
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                text
                    ${'$'}params copy, license
                    + MIT License
                    +
                    + Copyright (c) 2015 The Wizzi Team
                    +
                    ${'$'}if license === 'mit'
                        ${'$'}include mit_license_text
                    ${'$'}elif ...

t/wfschema.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'The "wfschema" schema'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		p The wfschema, implemented by the wizzi-core plugin,
			\b is the meta model of a wizzi schema.
			\b It models a wizzi schema with the same semantic with which
			\b a wizzi schema models a Wizzi Model.

		p This documentation section has a circularity that may give
			\b an headache. It documents a schema that describe a schema
			\b using the same schema notation of the documented schema.
		p Some hints may help.
		ul
			li A wizzi schema describes a model in terms of element types, 
				\b with attributes, and relations between elements. 
				\b Elements can extend super elements. Relations, that
				\b do not have attributes, can be of kind parent-children (one-to-many, the default)
				\b or parent-singlechild (one-to-one).
			li Elements are described in a flat list. Relations hierarchy and
				\b element derivations are inferred from definitions.
			li The root element can be declared using the element attribute 'isRoot'. If
				\b not declared the root element is the first of the list.
			li Elements and attributes may have an optional tag attribute that defines a
				\b name alias shorter or with an easier mnemonic. wfschema examples:
				ul
					li 'e' for 'element'
					li 'a' for 'attribute'
					li 'r' for 'relation'
			li Node names of mTree nodes simply map to an element or attribute tag (or name,
				\b if a tag is not declared).

		ul The wfschema elements are
			li wfschema
			li exportTo
			li require
			li element
			li attribute, string, boolean, integer, float, date
			li relation
			li restrict, enum, minLength, maxLength, minValue, maxValue, regexp
			li method, function
			li parameter

		h3 wfschema element
		p The root element of a 'wfschema'.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e wfschema `name`
                    r require/s
                    r exportTo/s
                    r element/s

		h3 exportTo element
		p An exportTo element causes the insertion in the Wizzi Model classes
			\b of the prototype functions for exporting the tree data structure of the model in 
			\b the requested format
			ul
				li toJson()
				li toXml()
		p The entire Wizzi Model can be exported calling this methods on the root element.

		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    e export-to [json|xml]

		h3 require element
		p A Wizzi Model can contain user defined methods and functions,
			\b that could need to import objects from other modules. This element 
			\b allow to insert require statements in the generated Wizzi Model module.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e require `import-name`
                    string declareVar `name`
                        tag declare-var
                        optional
                        default `import-name`
                    string invoke `invoke-string`
                        optional
                    string kind [module]
                        # At now we have only one kind, and this attribute is superflous.
                        # Other kinds could be added in the future.
                        optional
                        default module
		
		p The generated statement is built in this way:
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			var `declareVar` = require('`import-name`')[`invoke`]
		
		p Example
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    require wizzi-utils
                        declare-var verify
                        invoke .verify
                    generates:
                        var verify = require('wizzi-utils').verify
		
		h3 Element element
		p Describes an element type of the schema.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e element `name` [: `super-element-name`]
                    tag e
                    string super `super-element-name`
                    string tag `tag`
                    string xmlTag `tag`
                        tag xml-tag
                    boolean isAbstract
                        tag is-abstract
                        default-when-declared true
                    boolean isRoot
                        tag is-root
                        default-when-declared true
                    boolean nameIsRequired
                        tag name-is-required
                        default-when-declared true
                    boolean addToChildren
                        tag add-to-children
                        default-when-declared true
                    r attribute/s
                    r relation/s
                    r method/s
	
		h3 Relation element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e relation `related-element-name`[-`plural-suffix-a`]/`plural-suffix-b`
                    # Examples
                    #   r column/s (element: column, collection: columns)   
                    #   r propert-y/ies (element: property, collection: properties)
                    tag r
                    boolean oneToOne
                        tag one-to-one
                        default-when-declared true
                    boolean noGet
                        tag no-get
                        default-when-declared true
		
		p Example:
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                ...
                    e table : dbitem
                        r column/s
                        r propert-y/ies
                        r displayLayout
                            one-to-one
		p related-element-name plus the eventual plural-suffix-a must give the name of an
			\b element defined in the schema (that is the related element); in the
			\b example: column, property, displayLayout.

		h3 attribute element
		p Describes an attribute of an element 
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e attribute `name`
                    tag a
                    string tag `tag`
                    string xmlTag `tag`
                        tag xml-tag
                    string type [string|integer|float|boolean|date]
                        default string
                    string default `default-value`
                    string defaultWhenDeclared `default-value` 
                        tag default-when-declared
                    boolean isDatatype
                        tag is-datatype
                        default-when-declared true
                    boolean isRequired
                        tag is-required
                        default-when-declared true
                    r restrict/s

		h3 string element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e string `attribut-name` : attribute

		h3 boolean element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e boolean `attribut-name` : attribute

		h3 integer element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e integer `attribut-name` : attribute

		h3 float element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e float `attribut-name` : attribute

		h3 date element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e date `attribut-name` : attribute

		h3 restrict element
    	ittf-panel
            ittf
                e restrict
                    is-abstract

		h3 enum element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e enum `enum-value` : restrict 

		h3 maxLength element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e maxLength `value` : restrict 
                    tag max-length

		h3 minLength element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e minLength `value` : restrict 
                    tag min-length

		h3 maxValue element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e maxValue `value` : restrict 
                    tag max-value

		h3 minValue element
        ittf-panel
            ittf
                e minValue `value` : restrict 
                    tag min-value

		h3 regexp element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e regexp `value` : restrict 

		h3 method element
		p Declares a method that will be added to the element class.
			\b A method can access and manipulate the entire 
			\b Wizzi Model, having access to the 'this.wzRoot()' method of the
			\b `schema-name`Base class.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e method `name`
                    tag m
                    r param/s
                    r statement/s
		
		h3 param element
		ittf-panel
            ittf
    			e param `name`
		
		h3 statement element
		p The statement element uses a subset of the schema 'js'
			\b implemented by the plugin wizzi-js.

		h3 function element
		p Declares a method that will be added to the module
			\b and will be a private function for methods of the model instances.
		ittf-panel
            ittf
                e function `name`
                    tag m
                    r param/s
                    r statement/s

t/xml.html.ittf.contents:
$group
    $
        var sect = {
            title: 'Xml pseudo schema'
        };

    html/docs/section(&sect)

		ittf-panel
            title Sample xml ittf document
            ittf
                profile
                    @ name ${'$'}{user.name}
                    @ age ${'$'}{user.age}
                    friends
                        ${'$'}foreach friend in user.friends

                            friend
                                @ name ${'$'}{friend.name}
                                @ age ${'$'}{friend.age}
                    address
                        @ street ${'$'}{user.street}
                        @ city ${'$'}{user.city}
		
		ul Rules
			li Ittf node names may contain
				ul
					li element names for elements
					li simbol @ for attributes
			li Ittf node values may contain
				ul
					li nothing for elements
					li name and value separated by a blank for attributes

		p ( It is assumed that one knows
			a xml format rules
				href https://google.github.io/styleguide/xmlstyle.html
			span )

index.js.ittf.contents:
module
    kind react
    
    $include _js/wz/core

    function m1_reset
        $foreach menuGroup in mpage.Nav1.menuGroups
            $foreach menu in menuGroup.menus
                $if menu.panels && menu.panels.length > 0
                    _ wz.removeClass
                        @ '#${menu.title}-dropdown'
                        @ 'css-1ropak3'
                    _ wz.addClass
                        @ '#${menu.title}-dropdown'
                        @ 'css-1sg6jvm'

    function eco_reset
        $foreach content in mpage.Main.contents
            $foreach panel in content.panels
                $if panel.kind == 'eco'
                    $foreach item in panel.items
                        _ wz.removeClass
                            @ '#eco${item.title}-dropdown'
                            @ 'css-17502ce'
                        _ wz.addClass
                            @ '#eco${item.title}-dropdown'
                            @ 'css-1ds30p3'

    _ wz.contentLoaded
        =>
            log 'contentLoaded'
            $foreach menuGroup in mpage.Nav1.menuGroups
                $foreach menu in menuGroup.menus
                    $if menu.panels && menu.panels.length > 0            
                        _ wz.click
                            @ '#${menu.title}'
                            =>
                                param ev
                                log "Clicked ${menu.title}"
                                _ m1_reset
                                _ eco_reset
                                _ wz.addClass
                                    @ '#${menu.title}-dropdown'
                                    @ 'css-1ropak3'
                                _ wz.removeClass
                                    @ '#${menu.title}-dropdown'
                                    @ 'css-1sg6jvm'
                                _ ev.stopPropagation();

            $foreach content in mpage.Main.contents
                $foreach panel in content.panels
                    $if panel.kind == 'eco'
                        $foreach item in panel.items
                            _ wz.click
                                @ '#eco${item.title}'
                                =>
                                    param ev
                                    log "Clicked ${item.title}"
                                    _ eco_reset
                                    _ wz.removeClass
                                        @ '#eco${item.title}-dropdown'
                                        @ 'css-1ds30p3'                                        
                                    _ wz.addClass
                                        @ '#eco${item.title}-dropdown'
                                        @ 'css-17502ce'
                                    _ ev.stopPropagation();
                            $if item_index == 0
                                _ wz.removeClass
                                    @ '#eco${item.title}-dropdown'
                                    @ 'css-1ds30p3'                                        
                                _ wz.addClass
                                    @ '#eco${item.title}-dropdown'
                                    @ 'css-17502ce'


            _ wz.click
                @ document.body
                =>
                    log "Clicked document.body"
                    _ m1_reset

index.html.ittf.contents:
html
    $
        var md = {
            title: 'Html packi starter'
        }
    html/layouts/std-layout(&md)
        frag()
        ul
            li
                a home
                    href /~-/home.html?context=mpage;home.model
            
        h1 Docs
        ul
            $foreach item in wzCtx.Doc.items
                li
                    a ${item.title}
                        href /~-/docs/${item.name}.html?context=mpage;home.model
        
        h1 Cheatsheets
        ul
            $foreach schema in wzCtx.wizziSchemas
                li
                    a ${schema.name}
                        href /~-/docs/cheatsheets/index.html?context=mpage;home.model|cs;docs/cheatsheets/models/${schema.name}.model;ittf/cheatsheet

index.json.ittf.contents:
{
    $
        var baseUrl = 'http://127.0.0.1:3000';
        var githubUrl = 'https://github.com/stfnbssl/wizzi/tree/master';
        // var baseUrl = "https://stfnbssl.github.io/wizzi";

	name "stfnbssl.github.io/wizzi"
	version "0.7.1"
	description "Wizzi github page"
	author "Stefano Bassoli"
	license "MIT"

    { Params
        title "Wizzi"
        baseUrl "${baseUrl}"

    { Github
        baseUrl "${githubUrl}"
        wizziCorePath "${githubUrl}/packages/wizzi-core"

    { Section
        [ items
            {
                title "Home"
                url "/~-/home.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Docs"
                url "/~-/docs/concepts.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Resources"
                url "/~-/resources.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Packy"
                url "/packy/index.html"
            {
                title "News"
                url "/news/index.html"

    { Doc
        [ items
            {
                title "Concepts"
                name "concepts"
                url "/~-/docs/concepts.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Ittf documents"
                name "ittfDocuments"
                url "/~-/docs/ittfdocuments.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "JsWizzi"
                name "jsWizzi"
                url "/~-/docs/jswizzi.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "mTrees"
                name "mTrees"
                url "/~-/docs/mtrees.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Wizzi schemas"
                name "wizziSchemas"
                url "/~-/docs/wizzischemas.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Wizzi models"
                name "wizziModels"
                url "/~-/docs/wizzimodels.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Artifacts"
                name "artifacts"
                url "/~-/docs/artifacts.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Wizzi factory class"
                name "wizziFactory"
                url "/~-/docs/wizziFactory.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Wizzi jobs"
                name "wizziJobs"
                url "/~-/docs/wizzijobs.html?context=mpage;home.model"
            {
                title "Wizzi plugins"
                name "wizziPlugins"
                url "/~-/docs/wizziplugins.html?context=mpage;home.model"

    { Starter
        [ items
            {
                title "wizzi-starter-wizzi-plugin"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi-examples/tree/master/packages/wizzi-starter-wizzi-plugin"
            {
                title "wizzi-starter-webpack-react"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi-examples/tree/master/packages/wizzi-starter-webpack-react"
            {
                title "wizzi-starter-mern"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi-examples/tree/master/packages/wizzi-starter-mern"
            {
                title "wizzi-starter-nextjs"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi-examples/tree/master/packages/wizzi-starter-nextjs"
            {
                title "wizzi-starter-gatsby"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi-examples/tree/master/packages/wizzi-starter-gatsby"

    { Plugin
        [ items
            {
                title "wizzi-js"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi/tree/master/packages/wizzi-js/dist"
            {
                title "wizzi-web"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi/tree/master/packages/wizzi-web/dist"
            {
                title "wizzi-lab"
                url "${githubUrl}/wizzi/tree/master/packages/wizzi-lab/dist"

    { Colors
        bg_0 "#ccc"
        bg_f_0 "#fff"
		c_0  "#000"
        bg_dark "#ccc"
        bg_dark_medium "#ddd"
        c_dark "#333"
        c_dark_medium "#555"
        h3_c_dark "#030"

    { Fonts
        useMaterialIcons true
        { materialIcons
            baseUrl "${baseUrl}/fonts"
            fontWeight "400"
            size "24px"
    
    [ wizziSchemas
        {
            name 'css'            
        {
            name 'graphql'            
        {
            name 'html'            
        {
            name 'ittf'
        {
            name 'js'
        {
            name 'json'
        {
            name 'md'
        {
            name 'scss'
        {
            name 'svg'            
        {
            name 'text'
        {
            name 'ts'
        {
            name 'vml'
        {
            name 'vue'
        {
            name 'xml'
